title.narrative: Ukraine Local Empowerment and Accountability and Development (ULEAD) Phase I

description.narrative:
Decentralisation is a top reform priority for the government of Ukraine. As part of the reform local councils have new responsibilities, including larger budgets and local executive committees. Since early 2015 local authorities have benefitted from decentralized budgets and laws have strengthened the linkages between districts. Further legislation is needed to bring the new arrangements in line with the constitution.
The Danish contribution to the decentralisation reform is provided via the European Union’s programme: Ukraine Local Empowerment and Accountability and Development (U-LEAD; 2016-2022) through a delegated cooperation to the EU.
The overall objective is to contribute to the establishment of multilevel governance, which is transparent, accountable and responsive to the needs of the population.
The specific objectives for the two components are: 1) To enhance the capacity of key actors at central, regional and local levels to implement the regional policy and decentralisation reform and 2) To improve delivery of local administrative services for the benefit of the citizens.
The programme is jointly financed by the EU, Germany, Poland and Denmark and is implemented by Germany (GIZ) and Sweden (SIDA).
